items.title: Update index.md

items.content_html: This PR replaces the comment above Markdownlint rule MD037 with a statement saying that it's disabled due to too many false positives.
items.title: Unlink PR from MD037

items.content_html:
Description

Updated the link to the Django website from the previous version (4.0) to the latest version (4.1).

Motivation

The motivation behind this update is to ensure that users have access to the most up-to-date documentation for Django. By redirecting the link to the latest version (4.1) of the Django website, we can provide users with accurate and relevant information regarding migration commands. This helps to maintain consistency and ensure that users have access to the latest features and improvements offered by the Django framework.

Additional details

Tested the updated link to ensure it correctly navigates to the appropriate section within the Django documentation.

@teoli2003 please kindly review
items.title: Update link to Django website to latest version (4.1)

items.content_html:
Adding a release note for aria image role:

<svg style="height: 150q; width: 150q; background: red;" x="0" y="0"></svg>
let mySvg = document.createElementNS("http://www.w3.org/2000/svg", "svg");
mySvg.setAttribute("style", "height: 100q; width: 100q; background: red;");
mySvg.setAttribute("x", "0");
mySvg.setAttribute("y", "0");

document.body.appendChild(mySvg);

other changes:

  • Added references to CSS specs for definitions of common length units.
  • Minor cleanup for:
\<type>
->
`<type>`

Related issues and pull requests:

  • Parent issue #27759

Bugzilla:

  • BUG-1829269
items.title: relnote(116): SVG q unit supported (defined in CSS length units)

items.content_html:
Description

The PerformanceNavigationTiming.notRestoredReasons property (see Back/forward cache notRestoredReasons API) is finally going to be launched in Chrome 116. This PR adds a reference page for the property, and a guide to using it.

This content is taken from the linked developer.chrome.com page, which will be redirected to MDN once it is live here.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Adds docs for notRestoredReasons

items.content_html:
Description

replace "timing function" with "easing function".

Note: I have not replaced this term in file: files/en-us/mozilla/firefox/releases/55/index.md and files/en-us/mozilla/firefox/releases/65/index.md as they are the Historical Release Notes.

Motivation

See https://www.w3.org/TR/2017/WD-css-timing-1-20170221/, w3c is now using "Easing function" instead of "timing function"

Related issues and pull requests

Continue: #27315, #27811
items.title: chore(css): replace "timing function" with "easing function"

items.content_html:
Description

Mention about the default value (GET) for the method property. When omitted, fetch() is always making a GET request.

Motivation

People familiarising themselves with the Fetch API need to know about the default method used.
I've seen people, unnecessarily adding { method: 'GET' } to the fetch() options as they are unaware that this is the default value.
items.title: Added note about default method value (GET)

items.content_html:
There was a spec change to make HTMLElement.togglePopover() return a boolean rather than undefined.

FF115 implemented this in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1833570 (supposedly, still testing).

This updates the page, and includes a live example. Good thing too, since the old version would not have worked (the popover was not defined as a popover).
I've also tried to make it clear that you have to think about the case where popovers are not supported - in this case the popover renders in place. I fix that in JavaScript, but possibly you should make the popup hidden by default and enable it in JavaScript. Dunno.

This is draft because I can't get the boolean stuff to work.

Related docs work can be tracked in #27417
items.title: FF115 HTMLElement.togglePopover() returns boolean

items.content_html:
Description

The default value for the filter function grayscale is 1, not 0.

Motivation

I am fixing incorrect information.

Additional details

The standard says so, here: https://www.w3.org/TR/filter-effects-1/#funcdef-filter-grayscale and this is consistent with behavior in at least Firefox and Edge.
items.title: Fix default value for grayscale() being 1, not 0

items.content_html:
FF116 supports TextMetrics.fontBoundingBoxAscent and TextMetrics.fontBoundingBoxDescent in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1801198

This adds a release note. I also updated the docs with a live example (essentially a live log) and updated to match template.

Other docs work can be tracked in #27758
items.title: FF116 Relnote/docs fontBoundingBoxAscent/Descent

items.content_html:
I am Japanese and my English is not good. First of all, sorry for using Deepl translation.

Description

We found that "cacheable" as written in the PATCH method is inconsistent with the RFC and other documents. This is the fix.

Motivation

This was clearly inconsistent with other documents. The "cacheable" documentation clearly states that cacheability of POST and PATH is "Only if freshness information is included".

However, PATCH says NO. We checked RFC5789, which describes the PATH specification, and found this to be incorrect.

I sent this PR because we believe this will cause confusion for other developers.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Patch method cacheable modified to "No" to "Only if freshness information is included".

items.content_html:
Description

Changed dead Acorn links to working ones.

Motivation

The old links took users to a sign in page, then a 404 not found page. The updated version takes users to the latest acorn homepage.

Additional details

Some Acorn links (eg: https://acorn.firefox.com/latest/styles/iconography.html) still don't function. I couldn't find a clear way to link to the updated page (https://acorn.firefox.com/latest/styles/iconography-q7JqGl5H) that would persist when "q7JqGl5H" is presumably changed in a future page update.

Related issues and pull requests

None
items.title: Fixed dead acorn links

items.content_html:
Description

I added an Accessibility Concerns section to the entry on the datalist element.

Motivation

According to MDN's accessibility expert's presentation, it's best to avoid using this element due to accessibility concerns. Adding this information would help tech professionals become aware of what to use in their products.

Additional details

This is where the change will be made.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #22958
items.title: feat: Add a accessibility concerns section

items.content_html:
Description

Attempt to better describe the behaviour of fetch.

Motivation

The previous wording was misleading because fetch does in fact reject for some HTTP status codes.

Additional details

Documents the behaviour seen today in Chrome 114.0.5735.198

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Change fetch description to match real world experience

items.content_html:
Description

The spec link in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/WebAssembly/Understanding_the_text_format for the binary format was broken. The only alive doc I could find was https://webassembly.github.io/spec/core/bikeshed/#modules%E2%91%A0%E2%93%AA (not exactly sure why the URL is like this but I guess section URLs are like this). This PR replaces the broken link with the correct one.

Motivation

I was disappointed by the lack of docs available for the binary format.

Additional details

Found it here: https://webassembly.github.io/spec/ in the W3C version under "5.5.16 Modules".

Related issues and pull requests

N/A
items.title: Fix WASM format link

items.content_html:
• Fixes #14589
  • Fixes #14679

To address first issue the PR sorts the possible value list in intro section.

To address second issue the last example has been updated to include inherited value scenario.
items.title: fix(CSS): update revert value intro section

items.content_html:
If you try to call this command as in example with only path name of article,
you will get the "Invalid URL" error.

Because yari-tool using URL constructor which can't accept path name without base.

Refs:

  • https://github.com/mdn/yari/blob/main/tool/cli.ts#L314
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/URL/URL#examples
items.title: fix: `add-redirect` command example

items.content_html:
Description

Add alt-used HTTP Headers to the list of conventional http headers.

Motivation

alt-svc is already present in the documentation but alt-used despite being a conventional and widely used http header is missing.

Additional details

  • https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7838#section-5
  • Note that the specification and browser compatibility of alt-used is left out and needs to be added to https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/
items.title: Add alt-used HTTP Header

items.content_html:
FF116 adds support for specifying allowed eternal files in CSP script-src directives as hashes.

This adds docs on the feature (been around for ages in Chrome), but in FF only supported for inline scripts before now.

Related docs work in #27749
items.title: FF116 CSP script-src can specify hash for external files

items.title: Mention isFinite surprises; align with isNaN
